meanings.definition: The classification of cells based on their structure and function.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use cytotaxonomies to organize cells according to their characteristics.
meanings.sent2: In biology class, we learned about different cytotaxonomies used to categorize cells.
meanings.sent3: The cytotaxonomies at the cell party were so organized that even the mitochondria knew where to go.
meanings.sent4: Her cytotaxonomies were like a well-arranged library, each cell finding its place on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The cytotaxonomies of plant cells were as diverse as a colorful garden, each cell a unique flower.

meanings.definition: The study of the taxonomic relationships among cells.
meanings.sent1: Researchers in cytotaxonomies explore how cells are related to each other in the body.
meanings.sent2: Cytotaxonomies help scientists understand the family tree of cells in an organism.
meanings.sent3: The cytotaxonomies gossip about which cell is most closely related to the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: The cytotaxonomies intertwined like branches of a tree, showing the connections between different cells.
meanings.sent5: The cytotaxonomies painted a picture of cellular ancestry, each cell a brushstroke in the masterpiece of life.
